name: places/ChIJiZlBXqZYwokRBClkbPurw08
formattedAddress: 1500 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1500 Lexington Ave, New York, NY 10029, USA

originalText.text:
I lived here for 2 years as it was a 6 minute walk from Mt Sinai Hospital. Vincent is wonderful, the front desk staff are all amazing kind and very helpful. If i ever needed help with anything or something needed fixing in my apartment it was taken care of immediately with no complaints. Location is amazing, next to CVS, City MD and across from Starbucks and also next to a dry cleaning store and a small deli. Also right next to the subway 96th stop. So really what more can a girl ask for. I always felt safe in the building. The people who live here are very nice I had no issues with any of my neighbors. People said hello with a smile. Great community
Gym was always clean, ALWAYS. Now im back in suburbia and miss my apartment!!!

originalText.text: I lived at Carnegie Hill Place for the last 3 years and it was such a great place to live! The building is maintained better than any building I have stepped foot in in NYC. Beyond that, the building staff are some of the nicest and friendliest people you will meet (special shout out to Eloy!) The building amenities are also excellent, with a beautiful rooftop deck and well maintained gym with 360 views of the city on the 20th floor. We rarely had issues with our apartment itself as they are very well built, but when we did they were addressed immediately. Location-wise, you can’t beat the proximity to the park as well as great restaurants and subway access. If you’re looking for your next apartment, CHP should be at the top of your list!

originalText.text: DO NOT LEASE in this building. The building management is not making necessary repairs as should be done in a property which is now over 20+ years old. Things are falling apart (Doors don't close behind you, washer/dryer room is filthy, elevators are messed up...) Rose Associates does not seem to care and the building super (Vincent O'Meara) is the most incompetent and unprofessional person you will come across. The older building staff is good but I can't say the same for the newer folks. STAY AWAY.

originalText.text: Whenever I run into prospective tenants being toured around the building, usually in the elevator, I deliver my standard ‘elevator speech’, which goes something like this, “longtime resident, exceptionally well-run building, you won’t be disappointed”. And that sums up how I feel about 1500. And during this Covid crisis it’s been that very sentiment in spades. The unpretentious, friendly and efficient staff has been fantastic in managing the increased deliveries and the changing delivery protocols, not to mention the building is kept spotless. Then there are the things like the modern meticulously organized and cleaned gym on the 20th floor with 360-degree views and the adjacent sun-drenched roof garden for morning coffee or sunset wine. And then there are things like Vinyl Wine & Beer across the street that carries not only great wine and beer but also great cheeses and charcuterie and my favorite thing, the Sesame Bread from She Wolf Bakery in Brooklyn.
